channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-2370] OSE Maven artifacts uploaded to fabric proxy cannot be resolved by containers
item.description:
Custom bundles deployed to the fabric maven proxy don't seem to be resolvable from other openshift containers in the same fabric.

 
 
 
 
        io.fabric8.common.util.MultiException: Error
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.download.impl.MavenDownloadManager$MavenDownloader.(MavenDownloadManager.java:93)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.download.impl.MavenDownloadManager.createDownloader(MavenDownloadManager.java:71)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.region.Subsystem.downloadBundles(Subsystem.java:329)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.region.SubsystemResolver.resolve(SubsystemResolver.java:179)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.service.Deployer.deploy(Deployer.java:261)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.service.Agent.provision(Agent.java:327)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.service.Agent.provision(Agent.java:187)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent.doUpdate(DeploymentAgent.java:569)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent$2.run(DeploymentAgent.java:216)
 
 
 
          at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
 
 
 
          at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
 
 
 
          at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
 
 
 
          at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
 
 
 
          at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
 
 
 
        java.io.IOException: Error downloading fab:mvn:io.fabric8.quickstarts/karaf-beginner-camel-cbr-foobar/1.2.0.redhat-053
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.download.impl.AbstractRetryableDownloadTask.run(AbstractRetryableDownloadTask.java:49)
 
 
 
          at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
 
 
 
          at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
 
 
 
          at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$201(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:178)
 
 
 
          at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:292)
 
 
 
          at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
 
 
 
          at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
 
 
 
          at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
 
 
 
        Caused by: java.io.IOException: URL [fab:mvn:io.fabric8.quickstarts/karaf-beginner-camel-cbr-foobar/1.2.0.redhat-053] could not be resolved.
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.download.impl.SimpleDownloadTask.download(SimpleDownloadTask.java:111)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.download.impl.AbstractRetryableDownloadTask.run(AbstractRetryableDownloadTask.java:40)
 
 
 
        ... 7 more
item.summary: OSE Maven artifacts uploaded to fabric proxy cannot be resolved by containers

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Some additonal observations... it seems that if I restart the container afterwards, the application itself is actually running on Karaf, but the container is still marked as "Failed" in Fabric, with the following exception in the logs.

2015-01-13 10:59:44,034 | WARN  | nload-2-thread-4 | AetherBasedResolver              | url.internal.AetherBasedResolver  419 | 49 - io.fabric8.fabric-maven - 1.2.0.redhat-060 | Error resolving artifactcom.redhat.xpaas.fuse:qa-cxf-portmapper:jar:1.0.0:Could not find artifact com.redhat.xpaas.fuse:qa-cxf-portmapper:jar:1.0.0 in karaf-default (file:/var/lib/openshift/54b540716892df0f510005ea/fuse/container/system/)
 
org.eclipse.aether.resolution.ArtifactResolutionException: Could not find artifact com.redhat.xpaas.fuse:qa-cxf-portmapper:jar:1.0.0 in karaf-default (file:/var/lib/openshift/54b540716892df0f510005ea/fuse/container/system/)
 
        at org.eclipse.aether.internal.impl.DefaultArtifactResolver.resolve(DefaultArtifactResolver.java:459)[49:io.fabric8.fabric-maven:1.2.0.redhat-060]
 
        at org.eclipse.aether.internal.impl.DefaultArtifactResolver.resolveArtifacts(DefaultArtifactResolver.java:262)[49:io.fabric8.fabric-maven:1.2.0.redhat-060]

        at org.eclipse.aether.internal.impl.DefaultRepositorySystem.resolveArtifact(DefaultRepositorySystem.java:295)[49:io.fabric8.fabric-maven:1.2.0.redhat-060]
 
        at io.fabric8.maven.url.internal.AetherBasedResolver.resolveFile(AetherBasedResolver.java:406)[49:io.fabric8.fabric-maven:1.2.0.redhat-060]

        at io.fabric8.maven.url.internal.AetherBasedResolver.download(AetherBasedResolver.java:356)[49:io.fabric8.fabric-maven:1.2.0.redhat-060]

        at io.fabric8.agent.download.impl.AbstractRetryableDownloadTask.run(AbstractRetryableDownloadTask.java:40)[80:io.fabric8.fabric-agent:1.2.0.redhat-060]

        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)[:1.7.0_71]
 
Caused by: org.eclipse.aether.transfer.ArtifactNotFoundException: Could not find artifact com.redhat.xpaas.fuse:qa-cxf-portmapper:jar:1.0.0 in karaf-default (file:/var/lib/openshift/54b540716892df0f510005ea/fuse/container/system/)
 
        at org.eclipse.aether.connector.wagon.WagonRepositoryConnector$6.wrap(WagonRepositoryConnector.java:1012)[49:io.fabric8.fabric-maven:1.2.0.redhat-060]
 
        at org.eclipse.aether.connector.wagon.WagonRepositoryConnector$6.wrap(WagonRepositoryConnector.java:1004)[49:io.fabric8.fabric-maven:1.2.0.redhat-060]
 
        at org.eclipse.aether.connector.wagon.WagonRepositoryConnector$GetTask.run(WagonRepositoryConnector.java:725)[49:io.fabric8.fabric-maven:1.2.0.redhat-060]
 
        at org.eclipse.aether.util.concurrency.RunnableErrorForwarder$1.run(RunnableErrorForwarder.java:67)[49:io.fabric8.fabric-maven:1.2.0.redhat-060]
 
        ... 3 more

The bundle indeed cannot be found in fuse/container/system/ ... however it is present in fuse/container/data/cache/

I am still getting the error when creating the OSE containers with the custom profiles directly (on 6.2.0.redhat.067 )

It seems to work OK if I create the container with the default profile first and add the custom profile later, but doesn't work when the custom profile is selected in the hawt.io when creating the openshift container, or when the custom profile is specified with the "fabric:container-create-openshift" command.

 
 
 
 
        io.fabric8.common.util.MultiException: Error
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.download.impl.MavenDownloadManager$MavenDownloader.(MavenDownloadManager.java:93)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.download.impl.MavenDownloadManager.createDownloader(MavenDownloadManager.java:71)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.region.Subsystem.downloadBundles(Subsystem.java:329)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.region.SubsystemResolver.resolve(SubsystemResolver.java:179)

          at io.fabric8.agent.service.Agent.provision(Agent.java:337)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.service.Agent.provision(Agent.java:190)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent.doUpdate(DeploymentAgent.java:569)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent$2.run(DeploymentAgent.java:216)

          at io.fabric8.agent.download.impl.AbstractRetryableDownloadTask.run(AbstractRetryableDownloadTask.java:49)
 
 
 
          at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
 
 
 
          at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
 
 
 
          at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$201(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:178)
 
 
 
          at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:292)
 
 
 
          at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
 
 
 
          at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
 
 
 
          at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
 
 
 
        Caused by: java.io.IOException: Error resolving artifact com.redhat.xpaas.fuse:qa-camel-websocket:jar:1.0.0: Could not find artifact com.redhat.xpaas.fuse:qa-camel-websocket:jar:1.0.0 in karaf-default (file:/var/lib/openshift/54ef5a596892dfa40300060e/fuse/container/system/)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.maven.url.internal.AetherBasedResolver.resolveFile(AetherBasedResolver.java:420)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.maven.url.internal.AetherBasedResolver.resolveFile(AetherBasedResolver.java:380)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.maven.url.internal.AetherBasedResolver.download(AetherBasedResolver.java:356)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.download.impl.MavenDownloadTask.download(MavenDownloadTask.java:33)
 
 
 
          at io.fabric8.agent.download.impl.AbstractRetryableDownloadTask.run(AbstractRetryableDownloadTask.java:40)
 
 
 
        ... 7 more

Could you test again with a recent build ? I've tried to reproduce it, but downloads do work correctly, even if I assign a profile requiring one of the uploaded bundle at the time the container is created.
Marek Schmidt Any feedback on this? DO you still see an issue?
Aileen Cunningham I've run several tests with custom bundles on 6.2.0.redhat.101-1, the issue seems to be resolved now. I'll let Marek to verify it also and provide final input here.

I can reproduce the problem with 6.2.0.redhat.101-1.

(following the steps to reproduce with the modified beginner camel-cbr and assigning the profile directly in hawtio... removing and adding the profile again on the already created container seems to work properly).

Marek Schmidt I've checked with latest RPM version 102-1 and couldn't reproduce the problem.
In the logs of first container (I've applied modified profile, using quickstart bundle, deployed initially to Fuse's maven repo) I got:

2015-04-07 14:09:34,749 | INFO  | dProxyServlet #1 | MavenProxyServletSupport         | xy.impl.MavenProxyServletSupport  200 | 155 - io.fabric8.fabric-maven-proxy - 1.2.0.redhat-102 | Received request for maven artifact : org/jbos
 
s/quickstarts/fuse/beginner-camel-cbr/6.2.0.redhat-102/beginner-camel-cbr-6.2.0.redhat-102.jar
 
2015-04-07 14:09:39,605 | INFO  | dProxyServlet #1 | MavenProxyServletSupport         | impl.MavenDownloadProxyServlet$3  182 | 155 - io.fabric8.fabric-maven-proxy - 1.2.0.redhat-102 | Writing response for file : org/jboss/quicksta
 
rts/fuse/beginner-camel-cbr/6.2.0.redhat-102/beginner-camel-cbr-6.2.0.redhat-102.jar
 
2015-04-07 14:09:39,614 | INFO  | dProxyServlet #1 | MavenProxyServletSupport         | xy.impl.MavenProxyServletSupport  200 | 155 - io.fabric8.fabric-maven-proxy - 1.2.0.redhat-102 | Received request for maven artifact : org/jbos
 
s/quickstarts/fuse/beginner-camel-cbr/6.2.0.redhat-102/beginner-camel-cbr-6.2.0.redhat-102.jar.sha1
 
2015-04-07 14:09:39,624 | INFO  | dProxyServlet #1 | MavenProxyServletSupport         | impl.MavenDownloadProxyServlet$3  182 | 155 - io.fabric8.fabric-maven-proxy - 1.2.0.redhat-102 | Writing response for file : org/jboss/quicksta
 
rts/fuse/beginner-camel-cbr/6.2.0.redhat-102/beginner-camel-cbr-6.2.0.redhat-102.jar.sha1

So child openshift container correctly downloaded the artifacts from first container...
The same (works correctly) happens when I set the versions of deployed quickstart to something that's definitely not in any other Maven repo.

Still doesn't work for me on build 102 when assigning the modified quickstarts-beginner-camel.cbr profile directly in the "Create new container" (and works OK if I create the default profile container first and assign it later).

Any idea about what debugging information I can provide to help debugging this? 

io.fabric8.common.util.MultiException: Error
 
  at io.fabric8.agent.download.impl.MavenDownloadManager$MavenDownloader.(MavenDownloadManager.java:93)
 
  at io.fabric8.agent.download.impl.MavenDownloadManager.createDownloader(MavenDownloadManager.java:71)
 
  at io.fabric8.agent.region.Subsystem.downloadBundles(Subsystem.java:329)
 
  at io.fabric8.agent.region.SubsystemResolver.resolve(SubsystemResolver.java:182)
 
  at io.fabric8.agent.service.Deployer.deploy(Deployer.java:264)
 
  at io.fabric8.agent.service.Agent.provision(Agent.java:346)
 
  at io.fabric8.agent.service.Agent.provision(Agent.java:193)
 
  at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent.doUpdate(DeploymentAgent.java:574)
 
  at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent$2.run(DeploymentAgent.java:218)
 
  at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
 
  at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
 
  at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
 
  at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
 
  at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
 
java.io.IOException: Error downloading mvn:org.jboss.quickstarts.fuse/beginner-camel-cbr-my/6.2.0.redhat-102
 
  at io.fabric8.agent.download.impl.AbstractRetryableDownloadTask.run(AbstractRetryableDownloadTask.java:49)
 
  at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
 
  at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
 
  at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$201(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:178)
 
  at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:292)
 
  at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
 
  at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
 
  at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
 
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Error resolving artifact org.jboss.quickstarts.fuse:beginner-camel-cbr-my:jar:6.2.0.redhat-102: Could not find artifact org.jboss.quickstarts.fuse:beginner-camel-cbr-my:jar:6.2.0.redhat-102 in karaf-default (file:/var/lib/openshift/5523fbedb1449045ef002ec1/fuse/container/system/)
 
  at io.fabric8.maven.url.internal.AetherBasedResolver.resolve(AetherBasedResolver.java:512)
 
  at io.fabric8.maven.url.internal.AetherBasedResolver.resolveFile(AetherBasedResolver.java:453)
 
  at io.fabric8.maven.url.internal.AetherBasedResolver.resolveFile(AetherBasedResolver.java:438)
 
  at io.fabric8.maven.url.internal.AetherBasedResolver.download(AetherBasedResolver.java:414)
 
  at io.fabric8.agent.download.impl.MavenDownloadTask.download(MavenDownloadTask.java:33)
 
  at io.fabric8.agent.download.impl.AbstractRetryableDownloadTask.run(AbstractRetryableDownloadTask.java:40)
 
... 7 more

The root cause is:

Could not find artifact org.jboss.quickstarts.fuse:beginner-camel-cbr-my:jar:6.2.0.redhat-102 in karaf-default (file:/var/lib/openshift/5523fbedb1449045ef002ec1/fuse/container/system/

looks like the artifact was removed(?) after it was downloaded. Is 5523fbedb1449045ef002ec1 ID of child or root container?

It is the child container.

Looking at the logs again, it seems the artifact is not being downloaded from the master after all (all the occurences of "Writing response for file : org/jboss/quickstarts/fuse/beginner-camel-cbr-my/6.2.0.redhat-102/beginner-camel-cbr-my-6.2.0.redhat-102.jar" seems to be from the cases when the profile was assigned after the container was created).

So it might be that the problem is a possible race between setting the master maven proxy as a maven repository and installing the bundles...
Hmm, you may be right - I've assigned the new profile after the child was created (and joined ZK)...
Hmm, your initial scenario (in description) says that you first created the child, and then assigned it a profile with custom bundle. This doesn't work either for you?

Please read my comments, I have reopened this issue with

It seems to work OK if I create the container with the default profile first and add the custom profile later, but doesn't work when the custom profile is selected in the hawt.io when creating the openshift container, or when the custom profile is specified with the "fabric:container-create-openshift" command.
Resolved here by correctly synchronizing threads for fabricService access.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. create a fuse OSE gear and an additional openshift container
  2. edit one of the quickstarts to change the artifact GAV (e.g. change artifactId in jboss-fuse-6.2.0.redhat-053/quickstarts/beginner/camel-cbr/pom.xml
  3. add to the quickstart pom 

        <distributionManagement>
    		 
           <repository>
    		 
             <id>fabric-maven-proxy</id>
    		 
             <name>FMC Maven Proxy</name>
    		 
             <url>http://admin:FusePassword@fuse-test.apps.example.com:80/maven/upload/</url>
    		 
           </repository>
    		 
        </distributionManagement>

  4. mvn clean deploy
  5. edit the quickstart profile in the wiki to use the updated bundle
  6. deploy the profile to the container
  7. notice the error
